meanings.definition: In an erudite manner; with great knowledge or learning.
meanings.sent1: She spoke eruditely about ancient history during the lecture.
meanings.sent2: The professor explained the complex theory eruditely to the students.
meanings.sent3: The toddler tried to explain quantum physics eruditely to his stuffed animals.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes sparkled eruditely as she delved into the depths of the subject.
meanings.sent5: The book was written so eruditely that even a child could understand the concepts.

meanings.definition: Showing or characterized by great knowledge or learning.
meanings.sent1: The eruditely written thesis impressed the committee.
meanings.sent2: He was known for his eruditely crafted arguments in debates.
meanings.sent3: The eruditely dressed man wore a bow tie with his pajamas.
meanings.sent4: Her eruditely decorated office reflected her passion for learning.
meanings.sent5: The eruditely designed museum showcased centuries of knowledge and art.
